answers.answer: I have had the complete previa my whole pregnancy. Having c section Wednesday. But I have been high risk my whole pregnancy. Gestational diabetes,  fibroids, blood disorder. All the best to you hoping it moves but mine never did. I never had any bleeding however. I've had dope the past 5 weeks biophysical profiles done and non stress tests. Everything has been fine I will say that :) good luck to you!!!!

I had a partial previa at my 20 week anatomy scan. At 25 weeks my placenta was 1 cm, which was the absolute closest they'd let me deliver vaginally (with much observation). However, by my 30 week scan, it had jumped to 8 cm away. Good luck!
Thank you both for the input. I'm holding out hope.

I had the same exact thing. Was told I had it at 14 weeks and it finally had just moved at my 32 week scan last week. Just be patient and take it easy and hopefully yours will move for you too. Good luck!
Thank you! I'm doing what I can to relax and wait this out.

question: Hi there! I was diagnosed at 17+4 with complete previa, and that was also my first bleed. It wasn't bad, but it scared the bejeezuz out of me! Just wondering if there are any ladies or there who have/has this condition? I'm hoping at our scan on 21st that it has migrated at least a little bit. I need some words of encouragement, TIA!
title: Placenta previa??
